questions.question_text:
A company organizes and runs conferences and other events. The company is considering using Dynamics 365 Marketing.
The company wants to ensure that they can implement key marketing features without requiring any customizations.
Which three capabilities does Dynamics 365 Marketing support using out-of-the-box functionality? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: It is ADE
I believe the answers are A,D&E

Selected Answer: ADE
correct

Selected Answer: ADE
Correct

A) Sponsors and sponsorships
D) Session and speaker tracking
E) Registration and attendance

Correct 
=> 1st - Sponsors and sponsorships
=> 2nd - Session and speaker tracking
=> 3rd - Registration and attendance

In the "new" marketing module when you create an event you can create "Sponsors and sponsorships", sessions & speakers can also be created & tracked + Registration and attendance can also be tracked by the records that get created in D365 Marketing

There is on option for advertisers and print media and campaigns to be created & tracked

For "Regulatory compliance" I am not sure, because in the marketing module it has the ability to comply with GDPR, but I am not sure if this will come under "Regulatory compliance"

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Project Operations to manage projects for customers.
You are training project managers on how to enter statements of work into the new system.
You need to ensure that the number of hours and the hourly rate for each item are entered.
Where must the project managers enter the required information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Item B does not make any sense.

comments.content: why ? i think the Project Operations is part of mb-910

discussion.content: Not in MB 910 anymore
A. Project contracts

Selected Answer: A
A. Project contracts.

Project contracts are used in Dynamics 365 Project Operations to define the terms and conditions of a project, including the number of hours and the hourly rate for each item. By entering this information into the project contract, project managers can ensure that the project is accurately tracked and billed according to the agreed-upon terms

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/project-operations/

In Dynamics 365 Project Operations, project managers can enter the required information, i.e., the number of hours and the hourly rate for each item, in the project contract's line items.

Here are the steps to enter the required information in the project contract's line items:

Navigate to the Projects workspace in Dynamics 365 Project Operations.
Open the project you want to create a statement of work for.
In the Project contract section, select the Line items tab.
Enter the line item details, including the description, quantity, and price per unit.
Ensure that the billing method is set to Time and Material or Fixed Price and Time.
Enter the number of hours and the hourly rate for each line item in the Time and Material section or Fixed Price and Time section, depending on the billing method.
Save the line item.
Once the project managers have entered the required information, they can generate a statement of work for the project that includes all the line item details, including the number of hours and hourly rates.

A. Project contracts

In Dynamics 365 Project Operations, the project managers would need to enter the required information for the number of hours and the hourly rate for each item in the "Project Contract" or "Project Task" entities. This can be done by creating a new project contract/ task record and filling in the relevant fields such as "Estimated Hours" and "Estimated Cost" for each item.

A. Project contracts

In Dynamics 365 Project Operations, the project managers would need to enter the required information for the number of hours and the hourly rate for each item in the "Project Contract" or "Project Task" entities. This can be done by creating a new project contract/ task record and filling in the relevant fields such as "Estimated Hours" and "Estimated Cost" for each item.
Has not the Dynamics 365 Project Operations been moved to ERP module?

B. Project stages

Which two features should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
